page.title: 19BODMIN MOOR
page.content: BODMIN MOOR IS A BEAUTIFUL,WINDSWEPT COUNTRY-SIDE,RICH IN LOCAL HISTORY AND LEGEND IN ENGLAND'S MOST POPULAR HOLIDAY COUNTY.IT WAS ONE OF THE FIRST AREAS TO BE INHABITED BECAUSE THE REST OF THE COUNTY WAS COVERED IN DENSE FOREST. NOWADAYS IF YOU CROSS THE MOOR BY NIGHT YOU CAN OFTEN SEE WHAT LOOKS LIKE LITTLE LIGHTS SHINING BETWEEN THE ROCKS, BUT ON CLOSER INSPECTION THEY ARE NOT LIGHTS BUT EYES OF SHEEP SPARKLING IN THE DARK. THE MOOR IS USED FOR GRAZING CATTLE, SHEEP AND MOORLAND PONIES. IT IS QUITE EASY TO GET LOST ON THE MOOR ESPECIALLY IN THE DARK OR MIST,JOHN WESLEY WAS ONE WHO DID. ANOTHER WAS DAPHNE DU MAURIER WHO LATER WROTE HER FAMOUS BOOK,'JAMAICA INN'BASED ON HER EXPERIENCE.THE NEARBY INN IS ALWAYS POPULAR WITH VISITORS.
